title: Pixel Art contest shortlist get your vote in!
body:
http://imgur.com/Qx1o6iK

Hey Summoners,

Thank you all so much for your amazing submissions! It was really tough to pick out the shortlist. You can find the shortlist below, make sure you head on over to vote. The top 10 most voted pieces will get a bit extra prizing =D

http://bit.ly/2c8VBrJ

Full album and honorable mentions to come soon!

replies.body:
I've entered this using my summoner name on league which is Phantasma although my username is OsakaR34. Also my email is cantthinkofarandomusername@gmail.com for reals. not a joke. My pals say my Zed art was good enough for the comp standards but I'm guessing I fell short somewhere but pls let me know if there were any kind of mistake on my part that stopped me from getting somewhere. Thankssss guys (:
EDIT: LOL OMG MY COMPUTER CLOCK WAS A DAY LATER, THUS I SUBMITTED TOO LATE :'D
OMG RIP LOL DDD: ANY LINKS SO WE CAN CHECK YOUR ART OUT ANYWAYS?? OO:

how come not everyone had gone to a shortlist? >.<
I'm so disappointed >:(

Some of the stuff that made it through just like, what the heck
still fun though 
still crying though
;'(

> [{quoted}](name=Zelren,realm=OCE,application-id=hIjvqaz6,discussion-id=d8AObWfb,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2016-09-12T09:01:32.254+0000)
>
> Some of the stuff that made it through just like, what the heck
> still fun though 
> still crying though
> ;'(

Riot tilts me lmao
It would be a long list in that case. <3
Yay, I got shortlisted!!! Up against some tough competition though - these all look amazing!
Congrats to all who were shortlisted! Looking forward to seeing the full album! :)

Hello, It's JustAProGirl

I recently entered the pixel art contest and i clicked on the link to vote to see if I had made it into the short list. At first, my pixel art was there and i had made it into the short list. After i visited the site again, it had gone and it wasn't there anymore. Any reason as to why it was removed?

Hey! 

You should be have an email in your inbox about this matter.
